name: InterContinental Montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed here for 2 nights with husband. Upon early arrival, due to early flight, they were kind enough to find a room for us and let us check in. Concierge gave us excellent map of city and some suggestions for sightseeing. Room very comfortable with nice TV (speakers in bathroom nice touch) and good bedding. Used fitness center sauna and pool, which was relaxing after long day sightseeing. No problems, highly recommend this hotel. Also, ideal location for everything, 5-minute walk from Notre Dame and connected directly to underground city/subway, etc.
reviews.title: High-end business-class hotel in great location

reviews.text: I Stayed here for 4 nights, the hotel is in great shape in a very good location easy to downtown shopping and old Montreal as well as the metro. Front desk staff were very friendly, I arrived at 8am from flying all night and was happily surprised that there was no issue with checking in so early. I had reserved a standard room but was informed upon check in that I had been upgraded to a Junior suite on the club floor. the Room was very large and clean with a separate bedroom with a large flat screen tv, the living room had two wing chairs as well as a large sofa and end tables with 4 large windows around the room. The club lounge was also excellent with good quality tapas and assorted beverages. Pool and sauna areas were well maintained and very nice. One of the best hotels I've stayed at.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a couple of days ahead of time on hotwire thinking I wouldn't get a nice place since it was Valentine's weekend, but was very lucky. The Intercontinental is in an excellent location - and the hotel is very clean with great rooms. Of course, the prices are exaggerated...$5 for a Coke in the mini-bar...I didn't have a drink in the hotel bar, but you are so close to Old Montreal why would you drink at the hotel?
reviews.title: Great Deal on Hotwire
A good hotel, brunch poorly organized, pool is odd, womens sauna not hot
reviews.text: The front desk staff were friendly, and the fitness room is open 24 hours, but not the salt water lap pool. The room was great with a nice view. Rooms start on the 12th floor, so they all have good views...and my favourite amenity in the room was the speaker in the washroom so you could shower and listen to what was on tv.
I would definitely recommend this hotel if you get it at a good price.
reviews.title: Never stay at this hotel nor in Montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in early Novemebr, and really enjoyed our stay! It is located on the edge of Old Montreal and central to most things and close to the Metro. It was a fairly short walk to St. Catherine Street for those who like to shop! The room was quite nice and roomy, the decor was lovely. We ate at their restaurant Osco one evening and also had a drink at their Absinthe bar. Sarah. B. The staff were friendly and helpful!
reviews.title: Nicely renovated, great city location!

reviews.text: We did have to call 2 days in a row for more than one face cloth. High speed internet was $15 per 24 hours.
reviews.title: Fantastic, friendly place

reviews.text: I stayed here for four days to attend a conference. The rooms are beautiful--recently renovated, very well laid out, huge marble bathrooms, comfortable beds. I was given a corner room, which was very nice. Never heard a sound from other guests.
reviews.title: Stay here if you like being treated like crap!

reviews.text: Every single staff member I encountered was very friendly. They generously let me stumble along in French, and they moved with ease between French and English.
reviews.title: Great hotel with great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ate dinner there the first night, and it was delicious--the scallops were especially good. The breakfast buffet was relatively modest--but in a way I liked. Most hotel buffets are too excessive. This one has just what you need--with wonderful, fresh ingredients for omelettes, which were beautifully prepared.
reviews.title: 5 Star at a three star price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For years I have stayed at The Intercontinental and I have never been disappointed! The staff is exceptionallt helpful and friendly! The doormen are fantastic and welcome you like you are a real friend!! George is the perfect doorman I have ever encountered in my travels! My parents went to Montreal often and Got to know the staff pretty well! My Mom passed away last year and I could not believe my eyes when George showed up at the service!!! Absolutely incredible and something my family will never forget!!!
reviews.title: the Best Hotel in Montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is excellent, right down to the oatmeal in the morning to the filet mignon melting in your mouth at dinner!!! I have stayed at the top Hotels in Montreal but none compare to my favorite, The Intercontinental!!!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel spoiled by pointless hidden costs!
Very good business choice
reviews.text: My experience at the Intercontinental was somewhat polarized. On the one hand, both the hotel and the service were excellent: comfortable rooms, well-decorated, clean and with good facilities, great location (close to downtown, the Metro and the old city) helpful staff – especially Gerry the concierge, who had a wealth of knowledge and always had time to share it, his help definitely added a lot to our Montreal experience. All of this definitely deserved the high ratings and reviews.

On the other hand, the hotel's policies really hampered our stay, with the “nickel and diming”: Internet, $15 a day (or $8 for 2 hours, there are Internet shops that make all their money from Internet services that charge less than that); Early check-in (if available), $25; Late check-out (even just a half-hour), another $25; Breakfast starts at $20 for juice, coffee and two pastries; Room service, additional fee, etc etc. It really felt like every request we had incurred an extra fee, which is absolutely not what a top-class hotel should feel like. I mean, if you were spending one night for a meeting in Montreal and your flights meant that you had to check in before 4pm and leave after noon, that's $50 extra right there, just for absolutely standard services that every other hotel (even the Holiday Inn Express brand in the same chain) is happy to offer for free! If a room is not ready for early check-in, that's perfectly understandable; but how is it fair to say your room is ready but if you don't wait around until 4pm, you have to pay extra? This isn't some kind of pay-by-the-hour flophouse!
reviews.title: Acceptable but nothing special, and don't expect anyone to be friendly.

reviews.text: If you get a good deal on the price, I would recommend the Intercontinental. I feel kind of bad about being so negative because none of the staff provided any bad service, nor were the facilities below standard. I just feel that in a 4 or 5-star hotel, you expect to be encouraged to approach the staff, to make any requests that you need, and that the establishment should try to accommodate these out of goodwill to enhance your stay as a valued guest. By the end of my stay, I felt like it wasn't even worth asking for anything because I'd just have to pony up, or feel embarrassed to decline because of the fees. If you stay here, you will not be disappointed by the staff or the hotel – just expect to add an extra 20% or so to your quoted rate, so you don't feel disappointed by that part either.
reviews.title: quiet hotel, interesting area...
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Very great hotel, close to old and new Montreal. Great view of harbor from the room
The staff all deserve huge raises...
reviews.title: a terrific hotel, phenomenal staff and superb food

reviews.text: delightful gal at the front desk (wears glasses)- incredibly warm and charming

description: Bienvenue to the InterContinental Montréal! The hotel is ideally located at the gateway of Old Montreal and the downtown core, twenty minutes from Pierre Elliott Trudeau’s International Airport. Elegantly overlooking the international business area, connected to the Montréal Convention Centre and the underground city, the InterContinental Montréal is perfectly positioned for your next business trip. Minutes away from the Notre-Dame Basilica, the Pointe-à-Callière Montréal Museum of Archaeology and History and the Quartier des spectacles, the hotel also offers a great location for cultural getaways. Begin your day with a succulent buffet breakfast at our Osco! restaurant or exercise in our salted water pool. Upon your return in the evening, enjoy Provencal tapas and an absinthe cocktail at the Sarah B. bar, and benefit from stunning views of the city from your luxurious and spacious guestroom. From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave, you'll experience an authentic Montreal je ne sais quoi!
